title: 2 charged in Brockton killing after months as fugitives, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Micheal Thompson and Dayana Slade were charged in connection with Mike Jonas's fatal shooting in Brockton, Massachusetts.
Thompson faces first-degree murder charges, while Slade is charged as an accessory after the fact to murder.
Both suspects were caught in Lewiston, Maine, after evading authorities since the September 2025 shooting.

title: Red Sox reportedly tried to trade for standout shortstop this offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox showed interest in trading for Angels shortstop Zach Neto, known for strong defense and 20-20 seasons.
Boston acquired Caleb Durbin from the Brewers, potentially filling third base, with Neto talks ultimately stalling over trade demands.
Neto remains under Angels' control through 2029, complicating his acquisition with high demands similar to Diamondbacks' Ketel Marte.

title: Former driving school owner gets 1 day in jail for RMV bribery scheme
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Carlos Cardosa, former Brockton driving school owner, sentenced to one day in jail for RMV bribery scheme.
Cardosa bribed RMV employee, paying $20,000 to issue licenses to 100-300 unqualified drivers from 2019-2021.
Cardosa pleaded guilty to honest services mail fraud; sentenced to six months home incarceration, $5,500 fine.

title: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B may have broken up following Patriots Super Bowl loss
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Stefon Diggs and Cardi B have unfollowed each other on Instagram after the Patriots' Super Bowl LX loss to the Seahawks.
Cardi B attended the Super Bowl party and gave a terse 'Good luck' as a message for Stefon Diggs.
Diggs faces arraignment on Feb. 13 for felony strangulation and misdemeanor assault charges following a December incident.

title: An emotional Alex Cora explains why Bad Bunnyâ€™s Super Bowl performance meant so much to him
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora praised Bad Bunny's all-Spanish Super Bowl Halftime Show for its cultural representation.
Cora expressed pride in Puerto Rico's portrayal on stage, highlighting cultural elements like coconut stands and piraguas.
Bad Bunny received support from NFL's Roger Goodell despite past controversy, for his unifying Super Bowl performance message.

title: Watch: Providence releases body cam footage of Brown University shooting response
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Providence released 20 minutes of body camera footage from the police response to the Brown University shooting in December.
The shooting by Claudio Manuel Neves Valente at Brown University killed two students and injured nine others on December 13.
The video, heavily redacted, shows police coordinating medical response and searching for the suspect in the active shooter situation.

title: Former Patriots lineman Keion White undergoes surgery after being shot in ankle in San Francisco
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Keion White, a 49ers player, was shot in the ankle in San Francisco and underwent surgery.
The shooting occurred after a verbal altercation between two groups, with no arrests made.
White, recently traded from the Patriots, is recovering from non-life-threatening injuries after the incident.

title: Jayson Tatum to practice with Maine Celtics as he nears potential return
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum assigned to Maine Celtics, practicing as part of his recovery from a May 2025 Achilles rupture.
Tatum has participated in controlled 5-on-5 scrimmages and workouts, indicating progress in his rehabilitation.
Celtics coach Brad Stevens says Tatum's return contingent on full health clearance and mental readiness.

title: Hikers rescued in Vermont amid sub-zero temperatures
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Two Canadian hikers, aged 21 and 19, were rescued in Duxbury, Vermont, by state police amid sub-zero temperatures.
The hikers faced life-threatening conditions near Camel's Hump mountain, prompting a 911 call on February 7.
Rescue teams reached the hikers by 11:20 p.m.; both are expected to recover after treatment for hypothermia.

title: 6 offseason priorities for Patriots after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots aim to strengthen the offensive line after six sacks and 11 hits on QB Drake Maye in Super Bowl.
New England may target WRs or draft prospects to bolster Maye's options, with A.J. Brown and Alec Pierce linked.
Patriots consider signing Christian Gonzalez to a new contract while assessing free agents like K'Lavon Chaisson.
